title: Possibly a heavily modified logotype
content:
I just posted this on the Type ID Board, Apologies for the duplication.

Does anyone have any idea what typeface is used in the logo below. I have a feeling that it is heavily modified.

Thanks in advance.  
Chris.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-04-15%20at%2010_4089.11.06.png)

Font: 

 Gotham 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053750/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: chrisbolton

comments.content: Very close to [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053750/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/overview) Narrow Black (editing /t top?).
As soon as I saw the ‘e’, the ‘a’ and the ‘y’ I was convinced it was Gotham but I was told to investigate further as that name didn’t ring a bell with someone close to the logo designer. Thank you.
